casebody.data:
Eldin SUMIC, Appellant,
v.
CONVERGYS CUSTOMER MANAGEMENT GROUP, INC. and Division of Employment Security, Respondents. No. ED 106812 Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District, DIVISION ONE. Filed: February 13, 2019 FOR APPELLANT: Eldin Sumic, Appellant Acting Pro Se, 4315 Forder Gardens Place, Apt. C, St. Louis, MO 63129. FOR RESPONDENT: Convergys Customer Management Group, Inc., Respondent Acting Pro Se, c/o Talx UCM Services, P.O. Box 283, St. Louis, MO 63166, Larry R. Ruhmann, Atty. for Division of Employment Security, 421 East Dunklin Street, Jefferson City, MO 65101. Before Roy L. Richter, P.J., Robert M. Clayton III, J., and Angela T. Quigless, J.

ORDER

PER CURIAM.

Eldin Sumic ("Claimant") appeals the decision of the Labor and Industrial Relations Commission ("the Commission") denying him unemployment benefits. We find no error has occurred.

No jurisprudential purpose would be served by a written opinion. We have, however, provided the parties a memorandum setting forth the reasons for our decision. The decision of the Commission is affirmed under Rule 84.16(b). 1

We deny the Division of Employment Security's motion to dismiss Claimant's appeal, which was taken with the case.
